IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Caring for the needy and homeless of the Denver Metro area and Northern Colorado.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Denver Rescue Mission is changing lives in the name of Christ by meeting people at their physical and spiritual points of need with the goal of returning them to society as productive, self-sufficient citizens.
IRS990.Desc: For people experiencing homelessness and poverty, basic needs like food, shelter, water, clean restrooms, showers, and laundry services can be difficult to access. The Mission provides these services in order to build trust and develop relationships with the people we serve, encouraging them to consider long-term solutions. Emergency services include the following programs: 48th Street Center, Fort Collins Rescue Mission, Holly Center, Lawrence Street Shelter, Lawrence Street Community Center, and Next Step Services.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The Mission's Community Outreach programs help better lives of vulnerable neighbors in low-income households while strengthening the whole community. The Mission provides groceries, clothing, furniture, referrals to social services, and more. The following services are included in Community Outreach: Ministry Outreach Center, Vehicle Donation Program, and Volunteers.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: The Mission's transitional programs help people who are experiencing homelessness despite having a job or steady income, transition into a sustainable, self-sufficient life. From an on-site living program to mentoring and assistance with the first month's rent and deposit on a long-term housing solution, the Mission's transitional programs meet the unique needs of working families, the elderly and those with disabilities. The transitional programs include the following: Bridge Transitional Program at The Crossing and Bridge Transitional Program Youth. Pathway Home Program serves individuals and families as they transition from homelessness to housing by connecting them with need supports that may be financial or community based.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: In the New Life Program (education), the Mission equips men to overcome various challenges such as broken relationships, job loss, lack of education, and drug and alcohol abuse and develop a renewed sense of hope and identity. The Mission offers the New Life Program at two locations: New Life Program at The Crossing and New Life Program at Harvest Farm.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Pet supplies, bus passes, motor oil

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grantee organizations are required to show proof of purchases by receipts and photos of materials and goods purchased with granted funds. Grants to individuals are primarily non-cash grants and are given based on need.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Housing allowance or residence for personal use
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Pursuant to Internal Revenue Service Code Section 107, ministerial housing allowances are provided for qualifying ministerial employees. This is not included in taxable income. CEO Brad Meuli met the qualifications for and received a ministerial housing allowance during the year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 7 Non-fixed payments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The board approved nonfixed payments made in the form discretionary bonuses.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Colorado Educational and Cultural Facilities Authority

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: Capital Improvements at three locations in support of Homelessness Resolution.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I, Line 32b Third parties used to solicit, process, or sell noncash contributions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A portion of donated vehicles are sold at auction by a local auction house.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I Explanations of reporting method for number of contributions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Cars and other vehicles - The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated. Securities - Publicly traded - The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated. Food inventory - The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated. Other - Hygiene products The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated. Other - Misc Items The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d Description of other program services
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: (Expenses $ 5,275,034 including grants of $ 831,728) In the New Life Program (education), the Mission equips men to overcome various challenges such as broken relationships, job loss, lack of education, and drug and alcohol abuse and develop a renewed sense of hope and identity. The Mission offers the New Life Program at two locations: New Life Program at The Crossing and New Life Program at Harvest Farm.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 was prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the officers and financial management team at Denver Rescue Mission. After this, the Board of Directors of the Denver Rescue Mission reviewed the Form 990 prior to the document being submitted to the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Denver Rescue Mission requires board members, executive officers, and key employees to complete a conflict of interest disclosure statement annually. The finance team monitors transactions and reports any potential conflicts of interest to the board. The person with a conflict excuses his or her self from the decision making process, and the board votes on whether or not the transaction is in the best interest of the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Denver Rescue Mission performs a study to benchmark the salaries of its employees with compensation surveys of comparable organizations. The goal is to match salaries and market rates for each staff position (including the executive positions) based on several nationwide and local employment surveys. The proposed salary ranges for each position are then approved by the Executive Team. Compensation for both the President/CEO and CFO is reviewed annually by the Finance Committee, which functions as the compensation committee. The Finance Committee's recommendations regarding executive compensation are presented to the independent Board of Directors of the Denver Rescue Mission. The Board reviews and approves the executive compensation. The Board's deliberations and decisions for the CEO's compensation package are documented in the Board minutes. The CFO compensation deliberations and decisions are documented in the employee's HR file.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: See response for Form 990, Part VI, line 15a

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents and conflict of interest policy available upon request. Financial statements are available on the organization's website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VII, Section A, Line 1a and Sch. J, Part II, column B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation reported in Part VII, column D and Schedule J, Part II, column B is the amount reported on the individual's W-2, box 1 or 5 (whichever amount is greater) per the IRS instructions. In the case of minister's compensation when box 5 of the W-2 is not applicable, box 1 compensation is used. Employee deferrals to qualified retirement plans are normally captured in box 5, not box 1 of Form W-2. For reporting purposes we have included the minister's retirement plan deferrals in Part VII, column F and Schedule J, Part II, column C.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Line 11d Other Miscellaneous Revenue
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MIsc revenue - Total Revenue: 51563, Related or Exempt Function Revenue: , Unrelated Business Revenue: , Revenue Excluded from Tax Under Sections 512, 513, or 514: 51563;
